data.text: Non Padded Quick Drying Shorts for Bike Touring
I'm looking for recommendations. For non padded quick drying shorts for touring. No spandex either. I am in the US.
Alpkit if in the UK
data.author: Debbie Miles

data.text: I go to thrift stores, buy swim trunks and cut out the netting inside. They always have some Velcro pockets to secure important things. I like stretchy waistbands, and of course they are fast drying.
data.author: Pedaling Pete

data.text: Heck, you might LIKE the netting.
data.author: Pedaling Pete

data.text: That‚Äôs what my husband wears. Dry really quickly. And cheap.
data.author: Mary Ann Rebecca

data.text: The Decathlon undershorts work for me. The sizing is a bit strange but if they fit the pad is very good.
data.author: Simon Farrar

data.text: Zoic MTB shorts
data.author: Sue Sommers

data.text: You also want no seams under your seated area, especially if you don't want padding.
data.author: Bill Dove

data.text: I have a hard time finding shorts I like because most all are polyester and smell awful after a few hours. I found that nylon is much better in this respect but very few options.
data.author: Michael Viglianco

data.text: Zoic Ether Mtb shorts. (without diaper)

data.text: I use my ‚Äúkayaking‚Äù shorts with interior netting. No underwear needed, can‚Äôt be easier to clean and dry. If not then my Prana cargo shorts and quick dry boxer briefs.
data.author: William Griggs

data.text: Outlier. Expensive but worth it. I‚Äôve had mine over 10 yrs and still my favorite pairs. LMK if you‚Äôd like pictures

data.text: ..investigate Fjallraven, Abisko‚Ä¶and LL Bean ..I have used both, I prefer Fjallraven..
data.author: Michael J Lewis

data.text:
I have the previous incarnation of these shorts from Decathlon. No padding, baggy, MTB shorts, tough as nails. They are also on sale at the moment for $30. https://www.decathlon.com/collections/bike-shorts/products/mountain-bike-shorts-900-black?
Rockrider ST900, Mountain Bike Shorts, Men's
decathlon.com
data.author: Mark Perry

data.text: I use my regular cargo shorts because they have ample pockets. Beneath those I wear a pair of Hanes boxer underwear. But, here's the trick: turn the underwear inside out to have no seams against your body. I've ridden all day like this including with a pair of cutoff Levi's babies with no chafing, etc. Yes, I've invested a lot of money over the decades in padded cycling shorts and still have a half dozen pairs. But, they're not my go-to garbs any longer. Pockets and comfort are what make my rides enjoyable.
data.author: Bill Bacon

data.text: Baggies, not babies.
data.author: Bill Bacon

data.text: Hiking shorts are typically designed to dry quick and have pockets!
data.author: Tom Kucklick

data.text: Check out MTB shorts. Can get lined or unlined.

Greg Wood

data.text: I took ''I am the US" as a seperate statement, and took it to just be about location when it comes to recommending suppliers.
data.author: Mark Perry

data.text:
I like Elevenpine.com riding shorts. They are a little stretchy but loose and you can adjust the leg opening for riding or off the bike. They offer an option padded lining that is true to size if you want it. I have a leather saddle so I usually just wear synthetic boxer briefs with them.
Elevenpine // The World's First Dual-Fit Shorts
elevenpine.com

data.author: Tom Moritz

data.text:
Endura Humvee II. They do come with a thin liner which is optional. I originally had no plans to wear the liner but actually kind of prefer it now. The shorts themselves are terrific. Comes in a bunch of colors: https://us.endurasport.com/hummvee-short-ii-with-liner-black/12924026.html?countrySelected=Y
Hummvee Short II with liner - Black

data.author: Justin Stephen

data.text: If you want quick drying woven fabric vs stretch, buy department store swim trunks that are going on closeout this late in the season and cut out the lining.
data.author: Chris Stratton

data.text: Is spandex banned in the US?

data.text: I always use swimming trunks only. Bicycling or not.

data.text: I've got a few different pairs of riding shorts from Swrve. They are my go to brand for cycling attire that looks good on and off the bike and functions really well in both too.
